DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Investigational Medical Device Exemption Attribution Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term representing the causal relationship between an Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) and a specific adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Investigational Medical Device Exemption Attribution
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy._Immunity from an obligation or duty._To assign to a cause or source.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.:Immunity from an obligation or duty.:To assign to a cause or source.

Concepts.definition: A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.
Immunity from an obligation or duty.
To assign to a cause or source.

treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.
